text: In vivo studies of the activity of four of the kinases, KinA, KinC, KinD (ykvD) and KinE (ykrQ), using abrB transcription as an indicator of Spo0A~P level, revealed that KinC and KinD were responsible for Spo0A~P production during the exponential phase of growth in the absence of KinA and KinB.
text_with_entity_marker: In vivo studies of the activity of four of the kinases, KinA, KinC, KinD (ykvD) and KinE (ykrQ), using abrB transcription as an indicator of Spo0A~P level, revealed that [E1]KinC[/E1] and [E2]KinD[/E2] were responsible for Spo0A~P production during the exponential phase of growth in the absence of KinA and KinB.

text: Transcription of ydhD was dependent on SigE, and the mRNA was detectable from 2 h after the cessation of logarithmic growth (T2 of sporulation).

text: Therefore, the physiological role of sigmaB-dependent katX expression remains obscure.
text_with_entity_marker: Therefore, the physiological role of [E1]sigmaB[/E1]-dependent [E2]katX[/E2] expression remains obscure.

text: sigmaF is controlled by a regulatory cascade involving an anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAB, an anti-anti-sigma factor, SpoIIAA, and a membrane-bound phosphatase, SpoIIE, which converts the inactive, phosphorylated form of SpoIIAA back to the active form.

text: The rocG gene of Bacillus subtilis, encoding a catabolic glutamate dehydrogenase, is transcribed by SigL-containing RNA polymerase and requires for its expression RocR, a member of the NtrC/NifA family of proteins that bind to enhancer-like elements, called upstream activating sequences (UAS).
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]rocG[/E1] gene of Bacillus subtilis, encoding a catabolic glutamate dehydrogenase, is transcribed by [E2]SigL[/E2]-containing RNA polymerase and requires for its expression RocR, a member of the NtrC/NifA family of proteins that bind to enhancer-like elements, called upstream activating sequences (UAS).

text: In addition to controlling transcription of phrC, sigmaH appears to control expression of at least one other gene required for production of CSF.
text_with_entity_marker: In addition to controlling transcription of [E1]phrC[/E1], [E2]sigmaH[/E2] appears to control expression of at least one other gene required for production of CSF.

text: The ald promoter, like the sigE promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]ald[/E1] promoter, like the [E2]sigE[/E2] promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.

text: Most cot genes, and the gerE gene, are transcribed by sigmaK RNA polymerase.
text_with_entity_marker: Most [E1]cot[/E1] genes, and the [E2]gerE[/E2] gene, are transcribed by sigmaK RNA polymerase.

text: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of gerE initiates a negative feedback loop in which GerE acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.
text_with_entity_marker: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of [E1]gerE[/E1] initiates a negative feedback loop in which [E2]GerE[/E2] acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.

text: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of gerE initiates a negative feedback loop in which GerE acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.

text: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: A low level of GerE activated transcription of [E1]cotD[/E1] by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed [E2]cotD[/E2] transcription.

text: ComK negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of comF-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.

text: Furthermore, YtxH and YvyD seemed to be induced after phosphate starvation in the wild type in a sigma(B)-dependent manner and in the sigB mutant probably via sigma(H).

text: DNase I footprinting showed that SpoIIID binds strongly to two sites in the cotC promoter region, binds weakly to one site in the cotX promoter, and does not bind specifically to cotB.
text_with_entity_marker: DNase I footprinting showed that [E1]SpoIIID[/E1] binds strongly to two sites in the [E2]cotC[/E2] promoter region, binds weakly to one site in the cotX promoter, and does not bind specifically to cotB.

text: A low concentration of GerE activated cotB transcription by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of cotX or cotC.
text_with_entity_marker: A low concentration of [E1]GerE[/E1] activated [E2]cotB[/E2] transcription by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase, whereas a higher concentration was needed to activate transcription of cotX or cotC.

text: SpoIIID at low concentration repressed cotC transcription, whereas a higher concentration only partially repressed cotX transcription and had little effect on cotB transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: [E1]SpoIIID[/E1] at low concentration repressed [E2]cotC[/E2] transcription, whereas a higher concentration only partially repressed cotX transcription and had little effect on cotB transcription.

text: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the sigX-ypuN control region.
text_with_entity_marker: We overproduced and purified sigma(X) from Escherichia coli and demonstrate that in vitro, both sigma(A) and sigma(X) holoenzymes recognize promoter elements within the [E1]sigX[/E1]-[E2]ypuN[/E2] control region.

text: The addition of ClpX to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but sigmaH-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ClpX-dependent stimulation than sigmaA-RNAP.
text_with_entity_marker: The addition of [E1]ClpX[/E1] to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but sigmaH-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ClpX-dependent stimulation than [E2]sigmaA[/E2]-RNAP.

text: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; SpoIIAB, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; RbsW of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.

text: The sigma W regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]sigma W[/E1] regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase ([E2]YteI[/E2]), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
